line: Single-Item Questions
label: heading

line: USMLE STEP 1 TEST QUESTION FORMATS
label: heading

line: A single patient-centered vignette is associated with one question followed by four or more response options.
label: paragraph

line: The response options are lettered (A, B, C, D, E). A portion of the questions require interpretation of graphic
label: paragraph

line: or pictorial materials. You are required to select the best answer to the question. Other options may be
label: paragraph

line: partially correct, but there is only ONE BEST answer. This is the traditional, most frequently used multiple-
label: paragraph

line: choice question format on the examination.
label: paragraph

line: S trategies for Answering Single One-Best-Answer Test Questions
label: paragraph

line: T he following are strategies for answering one-best-answer items:
label: paragraph

line: Read each patient vignette and question carefully. It is important to understand what is being asked.
label: paragraph

line: Try to generate an answer and then look for it in the response option list.
label: paragraph

line: Alternatively, read each response option carefully, eliminating those that are clearly incorrect.
label: paragraph

line: Of the remaining options, select the one that is most correct.
label: paragraph

line: If unsure about an answer, it is better to guess since unanswered questions are automatically counted
label: paragraph

line: as wrong answers.
label: paragraph

line: Example Item
label: heading

line: A 32-year-old woman with type 1 diabetes mellitus has had progressive renal failure over the past 2 years. She
label: paragraph

line: has not yet started dialysis. Examination shows no abnormalities. Her hemoglobin concentration is 9 g/dL,
label: paragraph

line: hematocrit is 28%, and mean corpuscular volume is 94 μm3. A blood smear shows normochromic, normocytic
label: paragraph

line: cells. Which of the following is the most likely cause?
label: paragraph

line: ( A) Acute blood loss
label: paragraph

line: (B) Chronic lymphocytic leukemia
label: paragraph

line: (C) Erythrocyte enzyme deficiency
label: paragraph

line: (D) Erythropoietin deficiency
label: paragraph

line: (E) Immunohemolysis
label: paragraph

line: ( Answer: D)
label: paragraph

line: (F) Microangiopathic hemolysis
label: paragraph

line: (G) Polycythemia vera
label: paragraph

line: (H) Sickle cell disease
label: paragraph

line: (I) Sideroblastic anemia
label: paragraph

line: (J) β-Thalassemia trait
label: paragraph

line: NOTE: Some item types that appear on the Step 1 examination are NOT depicted in the sample items provided
label: paragraph

line: in this booklet, eg, items with multimedia features, such as audio. Also, when additional item formats are
label: paragraph

line: added to the exam, notice will be provided at the USMLE website: http://www.usmle.org. You must monitor
label: paragraph

line: the website to stay informed about the types of items that occur in the exam, and you must practice with the
label: paragraph

line: downloadable sample test items available on the USMLE website to be fully prepared for the examination.
label: paragraph
